title.en: Junji Ito Short Story Collection: BEST OF BEST

altTitles.ja: 伊藤潤二短編集 BEST OF BEST

altTitles.ja-ro: Itou Junji Tanpenshuu: BEST OF BEST

description.en:
This volume includes ten of Junji Ito’s short stories, as selected exclusively from the Shōgakukan publisher catalog and presented and accompanied with a gallery of six color illustrations.  
  
Stories:
1: Army of One / Billions Alone (Okuman Bocchi, 億万ぼっち)

2: The Human Chair (Ningen Isu, 人間椅子)
A woman enters a furniture store in search of a chair, but the proprietor is all too eager to reveal its past...

3: Venus in the Blind Spot (Mouten no Venus, 盲点のビーナス)

4: The Licking Woman (Name Onna, 舐め女)

5: Umezz Kazuo and Me (Umezu-sensei to Watashi, 楳図先生と私)
A oneshot that appeared in Monthly Spirits 2014-11 to celebrate Ito and Kazuo being in an interview together.

6: An Unearthly Love (Kono Yo no Hoka no Koi, この世のほかの恋)

7: How Love Came to Professor Kirida (Miirareta Kirida Kyouju, 魅入られた切田教授)

8: The Enigma of the Amigara Fault (Amigara Dansou no Kai, 阿彌陀羅断層の怪)

9: The Sad Tale of the Principal Post (Daikokubashira Hiwa, 大黒柱悲話)

10: Keepsake (Wasuregatami, 忘れ形見)

Pin-up:
1: ''Kirie''
2: ''Ningen Shikkaku no Onna-tachi''

Gallery:
1: ''Frankenstein in Innsmouth''
2: ''Ningen Shikkaku''
3: ''Uzumaki''
4: ''Ningen Shikkaku''

biography.en:
Junji Ito (Japanese: 伊藤 潤二, Hepburn: Itō Junji, born July 31, 1963) is a Japanese horror manga artist. Some of his most notable works include Tomie, a series chronicling an immortal girl who drives her stricken admirers to madness; Spiral Into Horror Uzumaki, a three-volume series about a town obsessed with spirals; and Gyo, a two-volume story where fish are controlled by a strain of sentient bacteria called "the death stench." His other works include Itou Junji Kyoufu Manga Collection, a collection of different short stories including a series of stories named Souichi's Journal of Delights, and Junji Ito's Cat Diary: Yon & Mu, a self-parody about him and his wife living in a house with two cats. Ito's work has developed a substantial cult following, with some deeming him a significant figure in recent horror iconography.

In 2006, Junji married Ayako Ishiguro (石黒亜矢子), a picture book artist. As of 2013, they have two children.

Junji Ito (Japanese: 伊藤 潤二, Hepburn: Itō Junji, born July 31, 1963) is a Japanese horror manga artist. Some of his most notable works include Tomie, a series chronicling an immortal girl who drives her stricken admirers to madness; Spiral Into Horror Uzumaki, a three-volume series about a town obsessed with spirals; and Gyo, a two-volume story where fish are controlled by a strain of sentient bacteria called "the death stench." His other works include Itou Junji Kyoufu Manga Collection, a collection of different short stories including a series of stories named Souichi's Journal of Delights, and Junji Ito's Cat Diary: Yon & Mu, a self-parody about him and his wife living in a house with two cats. Ito's work has developed a substantial cult following, with some deeming him a significant figure in recent horror iconography.

In 2006, Junji married Ayako Ishiguro (石黒亜矢子), a picture book artist. As of 2013, they have two children.
